meanings.definition: A large whale with a hump on its back.
meanings.sent1: Humpbacks are majestic creatures that swim in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: We went on a boat tour to see humpbacks breaching in the sea.
meanings.sent3: The humpbacks decided to have a race to see who could swim the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The humpbacks glided through the water like graceful dancers.
meanings.sent5: The sight of humpbacks leaping out of the water is truly breathtaking.

meanings.definition: To hunch or arch one's back.
meanings.sent1: I had to humpbacks to reach the high shelf.
meanings.sent2: She humpbacks slightly when she carries heavy bags.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to humpbacks to look bigger in front of the dog.
meanings.sent4: He humpbacks over his desk to reach the computer screen.
meanings.sent5: The old man humpbacks as he struggles to stand up from the chair.

meanings.sent1: The camel had a humpbacks on its back to store water.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a humpbacks on the ground and wondered what it was.
meanings.sent3: The cake had a humpbacks of frosting on top.
meanings.sent4: The hill looked like a humpbacks in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The tree had a humpbacks where a branch had been cut off.
